FOREWORD
The following is a transcript of an oral interview conducted by the authors of the World Bankâ€™s fiftieth anniversary history: John P. Lewis, Richard Webb and Devesh Kapur, The World Bank: Its First Half Century, Washington, DC: Brookings Institution Press, 1997. It is not a formal oral history, and it is not a systematic overview of the work of the person interviewed. doc.abstracts: In November 1991, Frans Seda was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis, Richard Webb, Devesh Kapur. Prior to Bank, Mr. Seda worked as vice chairman of the budget committee of the parliament in 1960, as minister of plantations in 1964, minister of agriculture in 1966, minister of finance from 1966-1968, minister of communications and tourism in 1968. This transcript concerns the World Bank crisis in 1960’s; relationship of the Bank with Indonesia; and exchange rate.
